intro: Achyrophorus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted achyrophorus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
